CatDescriptText: Cutline of mage published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 4, 1957, p.23, reads: "Thompson Wedding - Thelma Evelyn Henderson, daughter of Mrs. Gertrude Long Hudson and James C. Hudson, became the bride of James Anderson Thompson in her mother's home. Here is the bridal party, following the rites which were performed by the Rev. S. C. Taylor of Rankin. - Harris Photo." Article reads: "Henderson - Thompson Rites - Thelma Evelyn Henderson made a lovely bride when she married James Anderson Thompson last week in charming rites performed at the home of her mother, Mrs. Gertrude Long Hudson.  The bride chose a white nylon for her waltz-length bridal gown and a short veil of imported illusion.  She carried a white Bible adorned with and orchid.  Given in marriage by her stepfather, James C. Hudson, the bride chose for her attendant Mrs. Gwendolyn Harper of Rankin, whose blue net over taffeta was a delightful gown.  Leslie Smart was best man for the groom, who is the son of Mrs. Nevadia Wilson.  Rev. S. C. Taylor of Emmanuel Baptist Church performed the ritual.  A reception followed for the scores of friends of the happy couple."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party with three men, possibly including James C. Hudson, best man Leslie Smart, and groom James Anderson Thompson wearing morning suit, and two women, including bride Thelma Evelyn Henderson Thompson wearing gown with lace overlay, and matron of honor Gwendolyn Harper, posed in living room of Hudson home
